project.project_id.description: The project ID is a unique identifier assigned to each project.

primary_site.description: The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories. Reference tissue_or_organ_of_origin on the diagnosis node for more specific primary sites of disease.

disease_type.description: The text term used to describe the type of malignant disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O).

follow_ups.ecog_performance_status.description: The subject's performance status (PS) score reported in its numeric format at the time of the visit. The ECOG PS is a determination of how well a subject is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

demographic.race.description: Subject's race that was collected at baseline, study enrollment, for the US cohort only.

demographic.vital_status.description: The survival state of the person registered on the protocol. CDE: 5.

demographic.ethnicity.description: Text designations that identify biological sex.

demographic.gender.label: Sex
demographic.gender.description: Text designations that identify biological sex.

diagnoses.age_at_diagnosis.label: Age at Diagnosis
diagnoses.age_at_diagnosis.description: Age in days at which a condition or disease was first diagnosed. CDE: 3225640. TCGA has the age in years with CDE 2006657, this is converted by ceil(age*365.25) to get days.

demographic.days_to_death.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date from a person's date of death represented as a calculated number of days.

demographic.year_of_death.label: Year of Death
demographic.year_of_death.description: The year component of the subject's date of death, if applicable. In a de-identified dataset, this variable will help with sequencing events.

demographic.age_at_index.label: Age at Index
demographic.age_at_index.description: Subject's age at the time of first therapy for multiple myeloma diagnosis.

family_histories.relatives_with_cancer_h.label: Relatives With Cancer History
family_histories.relatives_with_cancer_h.description: Count of relatives with malignant cancer diagnosis derived from family history table.

bone_assessments.lytic_bone_lesion_prese.description: Indication and number of lytic bone lesions found on scan if imaging_result="positive." If imaging_result was not "positive", then "not_applicable" is recorded.

bone_assessments.mm_bone_lesion_femur.label: MM Bone Lesion Femur
bone_assessments.mm_bone_lesion_femur.description: Indication that the exam found evidence of myeloma-related bone lesion(s) on femur.

bone_assessments.mm_bone_lesion_pelvis.description: Indication that the exam found evidence of myeloma-related bone lesion(s) on pelvis.

bone_assessments.mm_bone_lesion_ribs.description: Indication that the exam found evidence of myeloma-related bone lesion(s) on ribs.

bone_assessments.mm_bone_lesion_skull.description: Indication that the exam found evidence of myeloma-related bone lesion(s) on skull.

bone_assessments.mm_bone_lesion_spine.description: Indication that the exam found evidence of myeloma-related bone lesion(s) on spine.

bone_assessments.number_of_lytic_lesions.description: Number of lytic bone lesions found in exam.

bone_assessments.osteopenia_osteoporosis.description: Indication that the exam found evidence of osteopenia or osteoporosis.

outcomes.censor_os.description: A numeric (0/1) flag indicating whether the death has occurred (1=TRUE) or the subject was censored (0=FALSE).

outcomes.censor_pfs.description: A numeric (0/1) flag indicating whether the progressive disease has occurred (1=TRUE) or the subject was censored (0=FALSE).

diagnoses.best_overall_response.description: The best improvement achieved throughout the entire course of study period.

outcomes.survival_time_pfs.label: Survival Time PFS
outcomes.survival_time_pfs.description: For Progression Free Survival (PFS) analyses, the time from the index date to the patient's death or censoring.

outcomes.surivival_time_os.label: Survival Time OS
outcomes.surivival_time_os.description: For Overall Survival (OS) analyses, the time from the index date to the patient's death or censoring.

administered_regimen_lines.regimen_durat.label: Regimen Duration
administered_regimen_lines.regimen_durat.description: The length of time of the regimen/regimen component.

administered_regimen_lines.line.description: The line of therapy. It is important to note that multiple regimens may create one line.

administered_regimen_lines.first_line.description: The first regimen received by the patient for the treatment of this cancer.

administered_regimen_lines.regimen_name.description: The concatenated names of the drugs in the regimen; these are ordered alphabetically, though the steroids are last in the list. The drug names and regimen names are consistent with NCIt.

administered_regimen_lines.reason_for_di.description: Harmonized reason that the regimen was discontinued.

diagnoses.bmi_at_diagnosis.description: Subject's body mass index (BMI) calculated from height and weight recorded prior to first therapy for active multiple myeloma diagnosis. algorithm: (weight/(height*height)).

diagnoses.iss_stage.description: The multiple myeloma disease International Staging System (ISS) stage at diagnosis that prognostically categorizes the severity of multiple myeloma based on routinely obtained lab values.

diagnoses.days_to_diagnosis.label: Days To Diagnosis
diagnoses.days_to_diagnosis.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was diagnosed with the malignant disease.

diagnoses.days_to_best_overall_response.description: Number of days between the subject's date of first best response to therapy for multiple myeloma and the index date. In a de-identified dataset, this variable will help with sequencing events.

diagnoses.days_to_last_follow_up.description: Time interval from the date of last follow up to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

samples.sample_type.description: Text term to describe the source of a biospecimen used for a laboratory test.

samples.specimen_type.description: The type of a material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes. This includes particular types of cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory substances.

samples.tissue_type.description: Text term that represents a description of the kind of tissue collected with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue.
